thread.title: Inside Baz Luhrmann’s home

author: Jen Melocco Network real estate reporter
title: Inside Baz Luhrmann’s home
text:
THE typical trophy room in most Australian homes may feature a few gongs celebrating the occupants win in the local footy cup and some snaps of the team enjoying their celebration.
That is not the case at the home of one of the county’s most creative couples and celebrated cinema names Baz Luhrmann and Catherine Martin.
The Red Room, unofficially known as the “trophy room” at their Darlinghurst home Iona now on the market, is a whole other level. The pair put the home they bought in 2006 on the market last week as they now spend more time in their US base . Iona melds traditional features and modern luxury. Source: Supplied
The drawing room in a 1880s Italianate manor has grand proportions, an imposing marble fireplace and a plethora of awards and personal movie memorabilia.
In total the couple have won four Oscars, seven BAFTAs and 14 AFI awards for their work on landmark films including Australia, The Great Gatsby, Moulin Rouge and Strictly Ballroom. The wide veranda’s of Iona overlook the 2716sqm grounds, a rarity in inner-city Darlinghurst. Source: Supplied
From the walls look down the likes of Leonardo Di Caprio in studio shots of The Great Gatsby.
It is from this room that staff of the couple’s production company Bazmark Inq, whose offices have also been housed in the vast building, have watched the Oscars being handed out for their films.
Golden couple ... Luhrmann and Martin at the New York premiere of Paper Towns this week. Source: AP
However the lucky new owner of Iona will not just inherit a building with great cinematic memories but also live in a home that has been created by an Oscar winning set designer.
The residence that has been created is one with elements of drama, glamour and chic elegance. A family home and a creative hub. The grand entry hall with its handsome doorway featuring elegant stained glass. Source: Supplied
The grand entry hall is impressive and makes a dramatic impact with its towering ceilings, detailed tiled floor and a backdrop of a grand staircase perfect for a Hollywood star to descend.
In the entry hall and throughout many rooms of the grand residence the walls are lined with Antique Lace detailed wallpaper created by Catherine Martin. The former ballroom now houses a formal dining area big enough for a table of 12 and grand piano. Source: Supplied
In the ground floor ballroom, that has today been transformed into a large formal living and dining area, there is her Cockatoo wallpaper. The dining area has the proportions to easily fit a table for 12 and full size grand piano that sits in the bay window overlooking the leafy large grounds. Fittingly there is a large caterers kitchen that has pumped out food for a number of movie post-production parties. The caterer’s standard kitchen has created meals for many a celebrity. Source: Supplied
On the upper level elegant contemporary design elements blend seamlessly with the home’s traditional interiors.
The children’s bedrooms are delightful lined with Martin’s Circus Parade wallpaper and a fun and creative feel. The children’s bedroom is a riot of colour and features Catherine Martin’s original wallpaper. Source: Supplied
There are two main bedrooms each with bespoke cabinetry that can’t help but impress. A stunning dark timber cube in one of the main bedrooms is revealed to be a very sleek dressing room. With just a tap the doors of the dressing room part, the lights automatically come on and a meticulously designed wardrobe comes into view. One of the two main bedrooms which features bespoke joinery. Source: Supplied
Peering thought the bay windows of an adjoining living area one captures a vista of the rooftops of character-filled Darlinghurst beyond the property grounds. The second main bedroom is a stunning designer retreat. Source: Supplied
Throughout the home dark polished floorboards and impressive fireplaces, all with working gas fires, provide the home with a feeling of warmth.
Grand verandas, wide enough for plenty of lounging and entertaining, reach across two sides of the home. These verandas are the perfect spot to spend time in the warmer months to look over the large grounds with its own 18m pool, a rarity in inner-city Darlinghurst.
The property is listed with Michael Pallier and Harriet France of Sydney Sotheby’s International Realty. It is for sale through Expressions of Interest and has a price guide of around $16 million.
